messages.content: Be a Bible cross-reference expert. Using Genesis Chapter 2:1, list three of the most closely aligned Bible chapters in the Bible. At least one answer should be from the Old Testament and at least one from the New Testament  Do not provide verses. Also present three key bible topical words from the verse that have the most frequency in the rest of the bible. Output the answers without an explanation.

Answer: 
Old Testament: Genesis 2:2-3 - "And the Lord God formed man of the dust of the ground, and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life; and man became a living soul. And the Lord God planted a garden eastward in Eden; and there he put the man whom he had formed."
New Testament: Romans 5:12-19 - "Wherefore, as by one man sin entered into the world, and death by sin; and so death passed upon all men, for that all have sinned: And upon all sin did God inflict justice, as well as upon the sin, unto the presenting of the perfect boulevard to the crucifixion. And that we might be made the righteousness of God in faith: Hymenaeus and Philetus are not the only ones; but they also who have gone before have fallen asleep; and as Paul also said, Let every one that names the name of Christ depart from iniquity. But ferveret not, my dearly beloved brethren, that ye be forgotten of my God, who is the rock of your hope: And I know that the Lord will guide thee continually, and fulfill every promise unto you."
Bible Topical Words: 
1. God
2. Man
3. Garden 
Note: These answers are based on a search of the King James Bible and may not reflect the frequency of these words in other translations.
